text: the question of Nature and nurture is uh
I wouldn't call it settled but I I would
put it like this uh we are all born with
a genetic inheritance and that genetic
inheritance sets boundaries on what we
might become it it they they guide us uh
in the sense of establishing about one
quarter of the variation of what we
might become and that uh when it comes
to intelligence or personality it's some
minority of what we could become and
then against that genetic background
then our genetics and environment the
experiences that we have and the
nutrition that we get interact with one
another and that then shapes us over the
course of childhood and a lifetime and
so most of the
variation is uh so most of the variation
turns out to be believed to be
environmentally induced or you know
based on experience
and so it's some interplay between the
two that makes us who we
are one thing that's interesting about
child development is that so much of it
um there are so many changes that take
place in children's brains um not only
uh from birth to the age of six is when
people think of brain change but also
even through childhood and into
adolescence um so one thing that
probably does not help is passive
experiences for the child and the
classic examp example of this is the
Mozart myth the idea that playing Mozart
or the classical music to a baby will
make the child smarter what seems to be
important is active engagement so for
instance learning to play a musical
instrument is associated with um
improved spatial reasoning and that
seems to be something that really helps
a lot um another thing that helps is
talking to children it's been shown that
there's a positive relationship between
the the number of words a child hears
per day and IQ scores and this is true
even when you correct for uh social
economic status and so just simply
speaking to a child playing with her uh
talking with her that kind of cognitive
stimulation seems to have a lasting
positive effect on the child's
development and that's something that uh
that I think any parent can and should
do well it's certainly the case that
some people who are called Geniuses have
the ability to link unconnected ideas in

important fact of that that's sort of um
I would call that isn't so Mantic is

which is just the hard work of having

Dumber well look if Google removes the

us the ability to have these facts in

this is one area where we can think
about something that maybe gets lost a

uh or in many cases are people who have
a lot of information U directly at their
uh at their beck and call and they think

so one thing I've experienced at
Princeton is that public spaces where my
colleagues and I are likely to cross

and that seems to be a place where
there's a lot of ferment both socially

think one principle that comes up in

that's an incredibly important aspect of

personal networking between live people
